t: Psalm 68
God’s Majestic Power
For the choir director. A psalm of David. A song.
God*pn arises. His enemies scatter, and*ln those who hate him flee from his presence.
As*ln smoke is blown away, so*ln you blow them away. As*ln wax melts before the fire, so*ln the wicked are destroyed before God.
But*ln the righteous are glad; they*ln rejoice before God and celebrate with joy.
Sing*pn to God! Sing praises to his name. Exalt*ln him who rides on the clouds- his*ln name is the Lord-*s and celebrate before him.
God*ln in his holy dwelling is a*ln father of the fatherless and*ln a champion of widows.
God*ln provides homes for those who are deserted. He*ln leads out the prisoners to prosperity, but*ln the rebellious live in a scorched land.
God,*pn when you went out before your people, when*ln you marched through the desert, Selah*ig
the*ln earth trembled and the skies poured rain before*ln God, the God of Sinai, before*ln God, the God of Israel.
You,*ln God, showered abundant rain; you*ln revived your inheritance when it languished.
Your*ln people settled in it; God,*ln you provided for the poor by your goodness.
The*pn Lord gave the command; a*ln great company of women brought the good news:
“The*ln kings of the armies flee - they flee!” She*ln who stays at home divides the spoil.
While*ln you lie among the sheep pens, the*ln wings of a dove are covered with silver, and*ln its feathers with glistening gold.
When*ln the Almighty scattered kings in the land, it*ln snowed on Zalmon.
Mount*pn Bashan is God’s towering mountain; Mount*ln Bashan is a mountain of many peaks.
Why*ln gaze with envy, you mountain peaks, at*ln the mountain God desired for his abode? The*ln Lord*s will dwell there forever!
God’s*ln chariots are tens of thousands, thousands*ln and thousands; the*ln Lord is among them in the sanctuary as*ln he was at Sinai.
You*ln ascended to the heights, taking away captives; you*ln received gifts from people, even*ln from the rebellious, so*ln that the Lord*s God might dwell there.
Blessed*pn be the Lord! Day*ln after day he bears our burdens; God*ln is our salvation. Selah*ig
Our*ln God is a God of salvation, and*ln escape from death belongs to the Lord*s my Lord.
Surely*ln God crushes the heads of his enemies, the*ln hairy brow of one who goes on in his guilty acts.
The*ln Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan; I*ln will bring them back from the depths of the sea
so*ln that your foot may wade in blood and*ln your dogs’ tongues may have their share from*ln the enemies.”
People*ln have seen your procession, God, the*ln procession of my God, my*ln King, in the sanctuary.
Singers*ln lead the way, with*ln musicians following; among*ln them are young women playing*ln tambourines.
Bless*ln God in the assemblies; bless*ln the Lord*s from the fountain of Israel.
There*ln is Benjamin, the youngest, leading them, the*ln rulers of Judah in their assembly, the*ln rulers of Zebulun, the rulers of Naphtali.
Your*pn God has decreed your strength. Show*ln your strength, God, you*ln who have acted on our behalf.
Because*ln of your temple at Jerusalem, kings*ln will bring tribute to you.
Rebuke*ln the beast in the reeds, the*ln herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples. Trample*ln underfoot those with bars of silver. Scatter*ln the peoples who take pleasure in war.
Ambassadors*ln will come from Egypt; Cush*ln will stretch out its hands to God.
Sing*pn to God, you kingdoms of the earth; sing*ln praise to the Lord, Selah*ig
to*ln him who rides in the ancient, highest heavens. Look,*ln he thunders with his powerful voice!
Ascribe*ln power to God. His*ln majesty is over Israel; his*ln power is among the clouds.
God,*ln you are awe-inspiring in your sanctuaries. The*ln God of Israel gives power and strength to his people. Blessed*ln be God!
